Setting up a data converter
As part of a custom ETL process (for more information, refer to
Setting up an ETL schema
), a data converter is used when the data types in the
source
and receiver do not match. For example, if the custom attribute value is represented as an Object in the System and the data is represented externally as a Row. The converter is also used when several attributes are represented within one tag (for example), while in the System, these are different properties (attributes) of one object.
The setting of converters of different types is the same. To do this, click the
Settings
button of the item selected.
Note: the administrator can independently configure the visualization of
any type of the System object
(for more information, refer to
Configuring the visual
).
where:
Setting
Purpose
Schema item outputs
Adjusting the output data of the converter. Described below.
Data converters
Customizing the change/generating the output data attributes. Described below.
Initially, for the
Converter
item, the System will display a dynamic data structure (left) at the input, and a blank sheet (right) at the output. To transfer data, click the
button.
Adding the entire item is available when you select the root object (object{1}) using
Add with hierarchy
.
If there is a direct attribute relation, the selected values on the right (highlighted in blue) will be highlighted in yellow on the left.
The data is transformed using the
button on the right.
You can perform the following actions to transform:
Delete a field.
Break the relation with the source: the field will no longer assign a value from the source. It is available to assign a value calculated by the algorithm (converter setting).
Add a converter: to transform a field value. Described below.
Add a field.
The converter transforms/forms the field value. Converters can be configured from the dynamic data structure, or in the
Data converters
table using the
button.
